content: Today I completed my first code.org intro to programming course thanks to Mr. June, my elementary school computer science teacher…
Completed introduction to web development with HTML/CSS on codecademy.com. Built my first personal website for a class project.
Started intro to computer science at Lincoln Park High School
Spent the last semester and a half following a guide and building out a copycat Flappy Bird web app for my sophomore year personal project.
Started more advanced math and economics classes at Lincoln Park High School.

Started interning at Community TV Station (CTVN) in Chicago where I am learning how to write, shoot, and edit short films/news stories. We have been using some pretty complex editing softwares and color grading softwares like Adobe Premier and Davinci Resolve. I notice that I excell more in using the softwares than the cameras

Started my first product line today. After a few months of searching for a product to dropship on aliexpress, I finally decided to start an all natural laundry detergent spray company called Beak. I connected with suppliers for the detergent ingredients, label manufacturing and shipping. I built my website using Shopify and custom react.js code. I'm working on the brand recognition and marketing at the moment refining my social media pages and content. Excited to see where this goes!

Beak has been popping off!! Sales have beeing doing so well I can hardly keep up.. Definitely seems like there is a lot of criticism about the product though, not sure how long this rain will last but I'm going to keep working hard and spending on marketing..

Beak traction has slowed down significantly. I've tried different marketing strategies and video ideas but I'm afraid the product just isn't fully there quality wise. I am at least net positive on my investment in this considering time and money so worst case scenario it might be time for a pivot.

I've pivoted from Beak in the last few months.. I've started a few other decently succesful stores in the last few months but most of them have only been generating a little profit. I've currently got 3 stores up right now: a basic merchandise store, a barcart store, and a tech gear store. I'm starting to realize the importance of brand recognition as these stores are generating sales but only correlating with when ads are purchased and run. Might need to shift my focus to establishing more brand recognition

Connected with international suppliers to get better deals and shipping times for products. Shut down my last few stores to launch a nasal breathing device product line. I've been seeing a lot of success advertising on facebook with this product so far. The plan is to get everything fully automated so I can just passively take my profits and pursue other projects outside of building shopify stores. It has definitely been a fun journey so far!
Covid-19….. No school now indefinitely… a little sad to miss out on the end of my senior year but excited for the free time to pursue new business ventures.
Started a little part-time entrepreneur internship with a non-profit in Chicago called Future Founders. Excited to learn more about what I love and meet more like-minded people!

Shut down my online e-commerce stores and pivoted to an eBay resale business. I’ve seen higher profit margins reselling designer clothes, model cars, and refurbished electronics, so I have invested all my time and e-commerce earnings to grow my funds. I’ve been going to garage sales, swap meets, and purchasing things on Facebook Marketplace/Craigslist to refurbish and resell on eBay for profit.

Just finished my internship at Future Founders! The internship was an accelerated entrepenuership excersise where the interns split into groups and spent 3 weeks coming up with a concept company/pitch. At the end, we all presented our concept companies to a board of mock investors (similar to shark tank) and the three best comapnies were awarded a small stipend. My group and I managed to come out in second which was super cool! It was fun working with likeminded individuals to come up with impactful ideas. Definitely learned a lot and made a lot of great connections! If you'd like to see our pitch, click here

It's been a fun summer flipping and reselling products (these two pieces of stage equipment were my most profitable flip of the summer), but I think it's time to move on. I’ve been talking to friends in finance and researching long-term stock strategies. I think I am going to reinvest my earnings from past projects. Been hearing a lot about cryptocurrency from my friends as well.. Need to do more research but most likely will buy in. Moving into college this weekend in Champaign, IL.. Very excited!!

Holy moly my investments have been doing really well. Getting into crypto was a good idea. Most likely going to sell soon, these gains are unprecedented and I don’t want to get caught in a bear market and lose all of my progress. Playing it safe.

Wow, was it a good idea to sell my Bitcoin and Ethereum… literally a week after, the price market dropped 50%. That kind of volatility scares me. I know something is up when my friends and family start asking about buying cryptocurrency, it's getting too big and the whales know it. They are going to take their profits and wait until the little fish get eaten up just to orchestrate another pump. Until then I will be waiting for my time to buy in…

Honing in on my long-term stock investments this summer (minus crypto). The summer has been pretty uneventful, I’ve mainly just worked on my application to transfer into the Economics department at Illinois. I’ve heard a lot about machine learning and AI, and since I especially excelled in statistics in high school I figured this is the best career move for me instead of going into finance (too boring)...
Got into Economics at Illinois, very excited to get better at econometrics and machine learning.

Have had some cool stuff in the works the last few months. Been working closely with a few of my friends to co-found a cryptocurrency investment club. Excited to announce that the Cryptocurrency and Decentralized Finance (CDF) club will be hosting meetings and recruiting in the spring semester!

Spent most of winter break planning content and events for CDF, excited to help teach people how to invest and grow their wealth. In the process of connecting with some cool speakers as well to encourage collaboration and networking within the club.

Spent the last few months grinding on school, making new friends, and working hard to grow CDF. Have hosted some pretty successful investing workshops and have helped a lot of students and peers learn about and get started investing. Looking for internships now for the summer #fingerscrossed

Just landed an internship position at Segalo Media as a data analytics intern! Excited to work closely with their crypto program this summer and inform investment strategy based on heavy research and data analysis. Grateful for the opportunity.

Started with Segalo Media last week part-time while still at school, set to start more hours June 1st. Also, I think I’m going to invest back into crypto.. Looks like a good time but there is still a lot of fear out there, need to do more research…
Just bought back into bitcoin at 17k let's ride!

Been doing really well at Segalo Media, doing a lot of research on smaller cryptocurrencies and learning a lot about how to conduct technical research on price movement. Made some pretty crazy alt-coin predictions so far.
Just finished my internship at Segalo Media, super grateful for the experience and skills gained, excited to see where the future takes me!
Bitcoin has been making some moves again, the alt-coins were popping off, internship went well… this has been a great summer… Excited to go back to school though.
Worked on a coding project with a friend of mine and got inspired to dive into programming more hardcore again. Enrolled for a Computer Science minor at Illinois.
Yeah so bitcoin took a hit the last few months. I’m optimistic though…

As much as we tried to save the club, I regret to announce that due to lack of attendance, the CDF club will be shutting down at Illinois. Unfortunately, people aren’t as excited about crypto anymore due to the last year of disappointment, and it's been a hard battle to keep people’s attention. That being said, my team and I aren’t giving up and have decided to take this as a sign to start our own private investment team where we will conduct our own research and trade. While most people would give up at this moment, we are continuing to chug along and meet weekly to continue to push towards our goals of success and financial freedom.

After excelling at the intro Computer Science classes at Illinois this semester, I have decided to double down as a programmer and set the goal to take the three intermediate CS classes (CS 124, CS 128, CS 173) simultaneously next semester and land an internship as a software engineer for the summer of 2023. It’s going to be a grind, but I’m confident in my ability to execute a goal I set for myself….

The start to the semester has been rough, I’ve been so busy and have had pretty much zero free time with all I have been doing. I have been seeing really good progress though and have gotten really good at coding. Confident about my ability to land an internship this summer, I will start sending out applications in March.
Started sending out applications to jobs.. Coding has been going well, I’ve really enjoyed learning more about C++ and it has helped me broaden my understanding of computer science so much.
Just got an internship offer at CBRE as a software engineer for summer 2023! So excited all my hard work these last couple years has paid off…

So happy to be done with that semester, it was an absolute grind but so worth it. I was able to kickstart my computer science career while continuing super meaningful investing and political conversations with my small team I’ve kept close since the ending of CDF. I see so much potential in my group and I’m excited for all of us to continue to level up.
Started my internship at CBRE! Super excited..
It’s my birthday, internship is going really well I’m absolutely killing it! I’m definitely getting a return offer!! Crypto is also starting to go up again, super exciting!

Just officially finished my software engineering internship with CBRE and landed the return offer for full-time employment when I graduate!! So excited! I also did so well they asked me to continue working part-time while finishing up my degree at Illinois. Excited for this next year!

Starting some really cool Computer Science classes this semester (advanced C++, distributed systems, Applied Machine learning) excited to learn more and hone my skills while continuing to intern for CBRE.
Starting a software project with a few friends… we are building a decentralized peer-to-peer transaction application and calling it sLush… stay tuned for more details.

Been a really fun semester so far. Learned a lot in my classes and have done some great work on this sLush project. CBRE work has been super chill and has been a great way to learn more/earn extra income while still in school… And holy moly CRYPTO!

Finished the semester strong! Super interested in machine learning, I’ve been having a lot of conversations about writing predictive strategies for trading with some of my Illinois CS masters friends. Going to lock in on sLush this winter break and finish it up so I can move on to more ML projects next semester.

Finally finished up sLush prototype! For more information, check out the section on my projects page! Was a super grueling journey, pretty much developing and designing the whole UI on my own. As cool as the project was, I will not be continuing to work on it as it was initially one of my friends' ideas from our early years of college and I really want to work on something of my own. I’ve enrolled in some advanced ML PhD courses in the Econ department for my last semester in undergrad. My plan is to continue studying, working part-time for CBRE, and eventually accept my full-time offer with CBRE for next year.

Classes have been going really well, I have worked on a few class-guided ML projects and have some plans to start more independent projects after I end school. Talks in the friend group of a post-grad Asia trip so super excited! Crypto is still popping off and I’ve been having fun buying and selling some of these smaller AI coins. Huge gains to be made in this potential bull market!
Asia has been confirmed! Booked my flights to Japan, Korea, and Vietnam, can't wait!!

Graduated this weekend with my Bachelor of Arts in Economics from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign! It has been an incredible time of fun and learning and I am forever grateful for the experiences and connections I’ve come out of school with. Can’t wait to start my life!
Embark for Korea tomorrow… it will be my first time traveling to Asia so I’m super excited! Hopefully lots of good food and experiences to come!

Just got back to America from my big trip (more info in the travel section of the site) it was absolutely incredible though! I start work for CBRE full-time in a week as an Application Developer so I am very excited!
Officially started as a full-time Application Developer at CBRE. Excited to keep honing my skills and I am extremely grateful to continue to work with such an intelligent and talented team!

Built out an API template last week using FastAPI and integrated it with a database/front end to build out a user authentication system. I plan to reuse this for multiple web app projects in the future. Check out the repo here

Started a machine learning project for building a predictive investment strategy for buying property in Chicago, specifically in the neighborhood Lincoln Park. This will be a project I work on periodically on the side of work and life to demonstrate my machine learning abilities as well as develop my true investment strategy for growing my personal wealth through real estate. Getting started on data collection, but I imagine this will be the most time-consuming process. Excited to see how this goes! repo available here

I’ve made some good progress on my data collection process for the housing prediction machine learning project. I made a friend in local real estate who has access to the MLS database, and he has been able to get me some good quality data on properties in the area. Right now the biggest obstacle to overcome will be figuring out how to process this data, as it is in PDFs for each sale on each property. This means a lot of documents for each property when it comes to evaluating historical data. The other thing to consider is that I will most likely need to survey 500+ properties in the neighborhood to have enough data to get accurate results from a forecasting model. This will be a lot of data and definitely requires some more work on how to logistically get this done.

It's been around 3 months since I started at CBRE full-time! I’ve continued to learn so much at this company and quickly have inserted myself as an indispensable asset to my team.. Excited for the rest of the year as we are working with some cool new clients.
